comments.author: Ishicryptic
comments.body: I don't think that it will surprise anybody that has crypto knowledge that El Salvador, still remains the top country when you are talking about Bitcoin adoption on a national level afterall they don't have any competitors yet at the national level. Let them continue to enjoy the lone top spot until another country seizes the opportunity of hodling the store of value as a national asset and have their citizens spend it like their fiat then maybe we can see a comparison. Bitcoin adoption is driven by individuals, groups and institutions and it is doing very fine as it is but I guess that the adoption will increase faster if more countries will act like El Salvador.

comments.author: Fiatless
comments.body: Quote from: Harambe on August 30, 2024, 09:31:01 PMüåç #BTC Three years later, El Salvador is still the number one country for 'Bitcoin' search volume on Google Trends.Also in the top five are Nigeria, Switzerland, the Netherlands and Slovenia.https://pbs.twimg.com/media/GWQnmzUXcAIMaEo?format=jpgSource: https://x.com/cryptosignals66/El Salvador has been consistent in its Bitcoin policies, so it is right to see them top the list. The country has stood firm even when some international organisations such as the International Monetary Fund tried to discourage it from continuing with its pro-Bitcoin policies. Central African Republic repelled its laws which made Bitcoin a legal tender because of external pressures. But El Salvador has kept accumulating Bitcoin and has no plans to sell. Nayib Bukele has said that the country sees Bitcoin as a long-term investment.¬† It is not also strange to see Nigeria on the list considering the youthful nature of the country's population and the devaluation of the Naira. Youths are mostly attracted to Bitcoin and a large percentage of the Nigerian population are youths. Citizens of the country are also using Bitcoin as a hedge against inflation.

comments.body: Because El Salvador is the top crypto-friendly country and accepts Bitcoin as legal tender. So usually Google will recognise it as the number one Bitcoin-friendly country. Even the government is holding Bitcoin. I hope we will see more countries like El Salvador in the in the near future.

comments.author: passwordnow
comments.body: With the acceptance of Bitcoin as their legal tender, no doubt why it is the top result when someone searches for a "bitcoin country". To be honest, when they didn't accepted it yet as a legal tender there are other countries that were considered one before. Like Malta, Japan, other Asian countries too. But because of this action that El Salvador did, they were the first in the history that has become an actual country that has adopted it. Not to mention the other countries that became first crypto friendly countries. Central African Republic supposed to be the next one but they didn't continue it from happening. But soon, we will see some other countries that might also declare Bitcoin as their legal tender. It is only a matter of time but we should be happy that the number of countries that recognizes Bitcoin is increasing. Maybe sometime in the next months, there will be countries like UAE that will be more friendly to crypto because of the type of government and rules that they are setting.

comments.author: Z-tight
comments.body: Quote from: Fiatless on August 31, 2024, 10:28:54 AMCentral African Republic repelled its laws which made Bitcoin a legal tender because of external pressures. That is not true, Central African Republic rescinded their BTC laws because of issues prevalent in their country, i don't think the country thought it through before making such a law. CAR is a very poor country, so many people in their country know nothing about BTC, neither do they use it, just like El Salvador though. The decision was also a complete failure because of problems like poor electricity, poor internet connection and even political problems in the country, etc. yes, the IMF raised concerns, as they would likely do, but that is not the reason why the law was rescinded.

comments.author: Rikafip
comments.body: Quote from: The Cryptovator on August 31, 2024, 10:29:24 AMBecause El Salvador is the top crypto-friendly country and accepts Bitcoin as legal tender. So usually Google will recognise it as the number one Bitcoin-friendly country. Their Bitcoin adaptation is quite strong, legal tender means it would be used like their fiat currency. Its simply based on Google Trend results, which is calculated by checking in which country people searched for keywod "Bitcoin" the most, relative to all other searches. And in that ranking El Salvador is first, Nigeria 2nd, Switzerland usually 3rd (depending on the timeframe you set.For example, this is the top 5 in the last 12 monthsQuote from: https://trends.google.com/trends/explore?q=bitcoin&hl=en-GBSee in which location your term was most popular during the specified time frame. Values are calculated on a scale from 0 to 100, where 100 is the location with the most popularity as a fraction of total searches in that location, a value of 50 indicates a location which is half as popular. A value of 0 indicates a location where there was not enough data for this term.Note: A higher value means a higher proportion of all queries, not a higher absolute query count. So a tiny country where 80% of the queries are for 'bananas' will get twice the score of a giant country where only 40% of the queries are for 'bananas'.
